H0.text: A ceramic dish is probably the most flexible among the objects in question.

H1.text: A wooden block is probably the most flexible object.

H2.text: A short steel rod is probably the most flexible object.

H3.text: A new rubber hose is probably the most flexible object among the options.

A4.text: The flexibility of rubber is appealing in hoses, tires and rollers for devices ranging from domestic clothes wringers to printing presses

A5.text: Rubber exhibits unique physical and chemical properties. Rubber's stressâ€“strain behavior exhibits the Mullins effect and the Payne effect and is often modeled as hyperelastic
